name: git
title: Git
description: Full-fledged Git Client for managing local repositories
author: ernest0n

commands.name: clone-repository
commands.title: Clone Git Repository
commands.description: Clone a Git repository from URL

commands.name: open-repository
commands.title: Open Git Repository
commands.description: Open a Git repository management interface

commands.name: configure-issue-trackers
commands.title: Configure Issue Trackers
commands.description: Manage URL tracker rules for linking commit messages

commands.name: manage-ai-message-prompts
commands.title: Manage AI Message Prompts
commands.description: Configure AI commit message prompt presets

preferences.name: defaultTerminal
preferences.title: Default Terminal
preferences.description: The default terminal app to open repository directory in (e.g. 'Terminal', 'Warp')

preferences.name: externalGitClient
preferences.title: External Git Client
preferences.description: The external git client to use for git commands (e.g. 'GitKraken')

preferences.name: commitsPerPage
preferences.title: Max Commits to Load
preferences.description: Number of commits to load per pagination page. Small values cause frequent lags during scrolling. Large values cause slow initial list loading.

preferences.name: maxBranchesToLoad
preferences.title: Max Branches to Load
preferences.description: Maximum number of branches to load in local and remote branches sections

preferences.name: maxTagsToLoad
preferences.title: Max Tags to Load
preferences.description: Maximum number of tags to load in tags list

preferences.name: autoGenerateCommitMessage
preferences.label: Auto Generate Commit Message
preferences.description: Automatically generate a commit message using AI when opening the commit message view.

scripts.prepublishOnly:
echo "

It seems like you are trying to publish the Raycast extension to npm.

If you did intend to publish it to npm, remove the \`prepublishOnly\` script and rerun \`npm publish\` again.
If you wanted to publish it to the Raycast Store instead, use \`npm run publish\` instead.

" && exit 1
